review: Visited the clinic almost 3 weeks back with my mother. She had pain and swelling in ankle due to arthritis and I had pain in heel (bottom part) due to spur/plantar fasciitis.  Though the explanation of the issue and examination by the assistant doctor was good, but there was no outcome of it. They are just forwarding a set of exercises to everyone irrespective of age and severity, whether they are 75 years old or 30 years old!!! My mother did the exercises for 2 days and her swelling and pain increased, she got swelling at the back of the ankle also, ******* *** *** **** ** *** ***** *** ***** **** ******** ** *** ***** ***** For myself, I continued doing the exercises exactly in the way they had told, but after 10 days or so, I also developed pain at the back of the ankle, and the heel pain is still there.  I had come here with lot of hope after looking at doctor's qualification and reading the reviews, in fact waited for 3,4 days to show him only since he was out of station, but it was of no use.  Looks like they are interested only in problems related to bones, for pains they are just handing over exercises and sending away.
reply_text:
Thanks for the review! Firstly, we need to note that the patient had advanced arthritis of the ankle.  This was clearly explained. At her age, with other medical problems, we did not want to suggest an ankle replacement surgery for her. Pain medications are not a long term solutions for this. As the patient had stiffness of the smaller joints of the foot as well, it was recommended that she does some simple stretches to keep the foot muscles supple. These are generic exercises and do suit for all age groups. It was clearly explained to the patient and family that these exercises will take 4 to 6 weeks of regularity before one can expect improvement. As the family had concerns, I had personally phoned them and discussed these issues. Inspite of that, when people expect long standing issues to get better within 10 days or 3 weeks, I am at loss for words. Fortunately, vast majority of our patients are not looking for a list of medications to be prescribed, but are ready to do the exercises for long enough period. For people who struggle to do the exercises themselves, there is always an option of taking help from physiotherapists, but that would mean one needs to be ready to shell out 15 to 20K for physio sessions. 
We do understand that people come to us with lot of hope. But patients need to understand that there is a difference between a sorcerer (Baba) and a Doctor and need the patience to go through the treatment and return back to clinic for review when necessary.
Lastly, yes we do have generic list of exercises for a lot of orthopedic conditions. Sometimes, the same list of exercises may be applicable to two different conditions. They work for most patients provided they stick to it!
Best wishes
-Dr Naveen

In conclusion, Dr. Naveen Kumar L.V. is not just a brilliant doctor, but also a kind and compassionate human being who deeply cares about his patients.
